info.title: Article
info.description:
The Article resource allows your app to create, publish, and edit articles on a shop's blog. Articles belong to a single blog, and can have any number of comments.

{{ '/api/reference/article.png' | image }}

paths.description: Retrieves a list of all articles from a blog. Note: As of version 2019-10, this endpoint implements pagination by using links that are provided in the response header. Sending the page parameter will return an error. To learn more, see Make paginated requests to the REST Admin API.
paths.summary: Retrieves a list of all articles from a blog

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: Filter articles by article author.

parameters.name: created_at_max
parameters.description: Show articles created before date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

parameters.name: created_at_min
parameters.description: Show articles created after date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Show only certain fields, specified by a comma-separated list of field names.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: Retrieve an article with a specific handle.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve.

parameters.name: published_at_max
parameters.description: Show articles published before date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

parameters.name: published_at_min
parameters.description: Show articles published after date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

parameters.name: published_status
parameters.description: Retrieve results based on their published status.

any.summary: Show articles of any published status.

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Restrict results to after the specified ID.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Filter articles with a specific tag.

parameters.name: updated_at_max
parameters.description: Show articles last updated before date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

parameters.name: updated_at_min
parameters.description: Show articles last updated after date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

200.description: Retrieves a list of all articles from a blog

x-examples.name: Retrieve all articles from a blog after a specified ID

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/blogs/241253187/articles.json?since_id=134645308" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::Article.all(
  session: test_session,
  blog_id: 241253187,
  since_id: "134645308",
)

paths.summary: Retrieves a count of all articles from a blog

parameters.name: created_at_max
parameters.description: Count articles created before date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

parameters.name: created_at_min
parameters.description: Count articles created after date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

parameters.name: published_at_max
parameters.description: Count articles published before date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

parameters.name: published_at_min
parameters.description: Count articles published after date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

parameters.name: published_status
parameters.description: Count articles with a given published status.

parameters.name: updated_at_max
parameters.description: Count articles last updated before date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

parameters.name: updated_at_min
parameters.description: Count articles last updated after date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

200.description: Retrieves a count of all articles from a blog

x-examples.name: Count all a blog's articles

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::Article.count(
  session: test_session,
  blog_id: 241253187,
)

x-examples.name: Publish a hidden article

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"article":{"id":134645308,"published":true}}' \
-X PUT "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/blogs/241253187/articles/134645308.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

article = ShopifyAPI::Article.new(session: test_session)
article.blog_id = 241253187
article.id = 134645308
article.published = true
article.save!

-H "Content-Type: application/json"

  cookies: request.cookies,

parameters.name: limit

properties.description: The name of the author of the article.
properties.name: author

properties.description: The ID of the blog containing the article.
properties.name: blog_id

properties.description: The text of the body of the article, complete with HTML markup.
properties.name: body_html

properties.description: The date and time (ISO 8601 format) when the article was created.
properties.name: created_at

properties.description:
A human-friendly unique string for the article that's automatically generated from the article's title.
The handle is used in the article's URL.
properties.name: handle

properties.description:
An image associated with the article. It can have the following properties:

  • attachment: An image attached to article returned as Base64-encoded binary data.
  • src: A source URL that specifies the location of the image.
  • alt: Alternative text that describes the image.
properties.name: image

properties.description:
The additional information attached to an Article object. It has the following properties:
  • key: An identifier for the metafield. (maximum: 30 characters)
  • namespace: A container for a set of metadata. Namespaces help distinguish between metadata created by different apps. (maximum: 20 characters)
  • value: The information to be stored as metadata.
  • type: The metafield's information type. Refer to the full list of types.
  • description (optional): Additional information about the metafield.

For more information on attaching metadata to Shopify resources, see the Metafield resource.
properties.name: metafields

properties.description: The date and time (ISO 8601 format) when the article was published.
properties.name: published_at

properties.description: A summary of the article, which can include HTML markup. The summary is used by the online store theme to display the article on other pages, such as the home page or the main blog page.
properties.name: summary_html

properties.description: A comma-separated list of tags. Tags are additional short descriptors formatted as a string of comma-separated values.
properties.name: tags

properties.description: The name of the template an article is using if it's using an alternate template. If an article is using the default article.liquid template, then the value returned is null.
properties.name: template_suffix

properties.description: The date and time (ISO 8601 format) when the article was last updated.
properties.name: updated_at

properties.description: A unique numeric identifier for the author of the article.
properties.name: user_id

x-shopify-meta.meta_description: Manage a store's articles. Each article belongs to a blog and can have many comments.
